content: Osama bin Laden is commonly referred to as a terrorist because he was the founder and leader of the militant Islamist group Al-Qaeda, which was responsible for several high-profile attacks against civilians and military targets. These attacks include the 9/11 attacks in the United States, the 1998 bombings of the U.S. embassies in Kenya and Tanzania, and the 2000 bombing of the USS Cole in Yemen. Al-Qaeda has also been linked to numerous other attacks and acts of violence around the world.
